alert.note: Alert for Randolph; Sharp (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued December 17 at 3:08PM CST by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...Flood potential increasing across western, northern Arkansas... ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT THROUGH LATE TONIGHT... The National Weather Service in Little Rock has expanded the * Flood Watch to include portions of eastern Arkansas and north central Arkansas, including the following areas, in eastern Arkansas, Randolph. In north central Arkansas, Sharp. * Through late tonight * Despite drier soils, persistent rainfall across portions of the watch area will pose a flood risk through tonight. The highest potential for flooding will be across northwestern Arkansas, although localized flooding will be possible anywhere in and near the watch.
info.instruction: A Flood Watch means there is a potential for flooding based on current forecasts. You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
